snippet: India has already eclipsed China as Iran’s No. 1 petroleum customer, subverting efforts by the United States to persuade other countries to find non-Iranian sources for their energy needs.
abstract: India announces it is sending a large trade delegation to Iran to exploit opportunities created by the American and European antinuclear sanctions, which have been increasingly disrupting Iran’s economy; Western officials, noting that India has now eclipsed China as Iran's top petroleum customer, worry that relationship is subverting efforts by the United States to persuade other countries to find non-Iranian sources for their energy needs.
lead_paragraph: India has already eclipsed China as Iran’s No. 1 petroleum customer, subverting efforts by the United States to persuade other countries to find non-Iranian sources for their energy needs.

headline.seo: India Explores Economic Opportunities in Iran
headline.main: India Explores Economic Opportunities in Iran, Denting Western Sanctions Plan
headline.print_headline: India Explores Economic Opportunities in Iran, Denting Western Sanctions Plan
